info.headline: Excessive Heat Warning issued July 18 at 1:26PM MDT until July 18 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...EXCESSIVE HEAT WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM MDT THIS EVENING... ...EXCESSIVE HEAT WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 9 PM MDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...For the first Excessive Heat Warning, dangerously hot conditions with temperatures between 108 and 111. For the second Excessive Heat Warning, dangerously hot conditions with temperatures between 107 and 110 expected. * WHERE...Chaves County Plains. * WHEN...For the first Excessive Heat Warning, until 9 PM MDT this evening. For the second Excessive Heat Warning, from Noon to 9 PM MDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Heat related illnesses increase significantly during extreme heat events.
info.instruction: Drink plenty of fluids, stay in an air-conditioned room, stay out of the sun, and check up on relatives and neighbors. Do not leave young children and pets in unattended vehicles. Car interiors will reach lethal temperatures in a matter of minutes. Take action when you see symptoms of heat exhaustion and heat stroke. Heat stroke is an emergency! Call 9 1 1.
